title: Can wrong recharge be refunded in Jio?
content:
In general, Jio does not offer refunds for wrong recharges or accidental transactions. However, you can try the following steps:

1. Contact Customer Care: Call Jio customer service at 199 from your Jio number or 798 591 5420 from any other number. Explain your situation to the customer service representative.

2. Visit a Jio Store: You can also visit the nearest Jio store and discuss your issue with the staff there.

3. Use the Jio App: If you have the MyJio app, you can check for any options related to your recharge history or support.

While refunds are generally not provided, the customer service team may be able to assist you in some way, so it's worth reaching out to them.
creator: sumiraj777444

title: How do I complain about Airtel double recharge?
content:
To complain about Airtel's double recharge issue, you can follow these steps:

1. Contact Customer Care: Call Airtel customer service at 121 from your Airtel number or 07985-915-420 from any other number. Explain your issue clearly to the representative.

2. Visit the Airtel Store: You can also visit the nearest Airtel store and speak to a customer service agent about your issue.

3. Use the Airtel App: If you have the Airtel app, you can raise a complaint directly through the app by going to the "Help" or "Support" section.

4. Social Media: You can reach out to Airtel on their official social media accounts (like Twitter or Facebook) where they often respond to customer complaints.

5. Email Support: If you prefer, you can also send an email detailing your complaint to Airtel's customer support email address.

Make sure to have your account details and any relevant information handy when you make your complaint.

title: Firefox ha detectado una potencial amenaza de seguridad y no ha continuado a...
content:
Buenas tardes.

Estoy teniendo problemas del navegador al meterme en las sedes electronicas de organismos publicos para hacer registros, solicitudes y demas.

Al meterme por ejemplo en la FNMT.ES me aparece lo siguiente : No se ha conectado: Posible problema de seguridad

Firefox ha detectado una potencial amenaza de seguridad y no ha continuado a.. lguien podría estar tratando de suplantar el sitio y usted no debería continuar.

Los sitios web prueban su identidad mediante certificados. Firefox no confía en clave-dninbrt.seg-social.gob.es porque su emisor del certificado es desconocido, el certificado es autofirmado o el servidor no está enviando los certificados intermediarios correctos.

Código de error: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER


impidiendome abrir la pagina incluso dando a "avanzado"

he intentado en certificados añadir las paginas como excepciones pero me pone como que no es necesario y se mantiene el problema.


A ver si alguien me hace el favor y me sabe decir como poder arreglarlo.


Muchas gracias

title: Opening YouTube links in new tabs leads to 'Video unavailable'
content:
Hello everyone,

For some time, I have problems opening links in a new tabs (CTRL+click on link).

Whenever I try, the new tab opens but the web page would either not open at all or only partially. Examples: clicking link A while being on page B leads to C 1. A: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/contribute 

   B: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/firefox/form    C: Unable to connect

2. A: https://www.ebay.com/mye/myebay/watchlist 

   B: https://www.ebay.com/?mkcid=1&mkrid=711-53200-19255-0&siteid=0&campid=5339064144&customid=ROWss&toolid=20012&mkevt=1    C: Unable to connect

3. A: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VjTO1zeD6r0 

   B: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1PIar7Fd7WM    C: page opens, but in the video frame it says 'Video unavailable'

These problems do not appear, when I open links in the same tab. They also do not appear, when I open links in a new tab in another browser.

Thus, it must be some issue with Firefox' 'open in new tab'-function.

Any ideas what to do?


Cheers, Bart

title: Airtel wrong recharge refund?
content:
If you've made a wrong recharge on Airtel, here's what you can do to request a refund or resolve the issue:

1. Contact Customer Support:

Dial 121 from your Airtel number or call their customer care at 121 from an Airtel number or 06303-761-603. from any other number.

You can also reach out to Airtel via their official support email or through their app's support section.

2. Explain the Issue:

Clearly explain the error, including the recharge amount, the incorrect plan, and the account involved. If you made a payment through their website or an app, provide the transaction ID or receipt as well.

3. Request Refund:

Airtel typically does not offer a direct refund for wrong recharges, but they may be able to reverse the incorrect transaction or adjust your balance with the right plan.

In some cases, if the recharge is recent and it hasn't been used, they may issue a refund or provide a different plan of equal value.

4. Visit Airtel Store (if necessary):

If online or phone support doesn't resolve the issue, you can visit a local Airtel store with your transaction details to request assistance.

5. Check Airtel’s Refund Policy:

Airtel's official policy may vary, and they may have specific terms about refunds for incorrect recharges. Always check their official website or customer support for the most accurate details.

Make sure to act quickly, as most telecom companies have a time limit within which such errors can be rectified.

title: I accidentally hit keys and then I lose all my work.
content:
When I use Firefox, I use CTRL key combinations to cut, copy, paste, and delete. I also use F5 to refresh a webpage.

Firefox uses many, many other key combinations and hotkeys, and a great number of them have caused the instant erasure of all the hours of work I had done on a webpage: The browser jumps to another tab, or it goes fullscreen (one of the Function keys does this), or it opens a new window, or it opens a History window, or it does any number of things which I neither want nor need.

I require only to use the key combinations and hotkeys to perform the functions that I have listed, above. But if I must sacrifice them in an overall disable, then I will do so.

Please tell me how to disable the key combination commands and hotkeys in Firefox.

I navigated to the history options with the idea of retoring the previous session - either using that functionality or individually opening previous windows - but history was blank and the previous windows option was greyed out. I'd be very grateful for any suggestions!
creator: robin_russel

title: Windows Security popup blocks user input
content:
As WIN11 Pro administrator, using Firefox desktop 132.0.1, a popup saying "Windows Security - Do you want to allow public and private networks to access app? firefox.exe"

This popup blocked all user input except to click on the popup. That behavior is suspicious, so I used ctrl-alt-delete to close it - but no user input was allowed because the Task Manager was behind the modal full-screen popup. I manually shutdown (uncontrolled crash) rather than click on it. I suspect this popup is normal behavior, though I've never seen or heard of it before. Not all software plays fair after all. Nothing to report from perfmon.msc > reliability report. But we live in a software minefield, and I can't find record of anyone stepping on this mine before. If anyone has seen or heard of similar please make a comment. Thank you guys!

title: Firefox some video playback very choppy (single frame every n seconds)
content:
Hey all,

After a fresh windows install I ran in to an issue where Firefox has issues playing back videos. It is most noticeable on Reddit, but other video sites that are not Youtube (for some reason Youtube videos, even when embedded in Reddit) have the same issue.

What happens is: a video shows the first frame. I press play and it plays at an extremely low rate 1 frame every few seconds, I can't really tell whether it goes from frame 1 to 2, but it definitely does not go from 1 to 1+(time past * frame rate). Another symptom that seems to be reddit embedded video specific is that after some time it says "video not available."

Videos do play for a very short while after rebooting, and clearing cookies also seems to help, however after some time even clearing cookies has the video stopping again.

I ran the profiler for media on a completely fresh profile with no addins. I found a video, started the profiler and pressed play. I let it run for 2 frame changes and after that I stopped the profiler. I'm not able to really interpret what is going on, but I hope that someone can.

https://share.firefox.dev/4eKL4PT

I've shared device/troubleshooting info.

Windows and Firefox are installed on a 1TB Samsung Evo 970, which I think may be the only relevant bit of info that's not in there.

If there is any other info that I can provide I am happy to do so.
creator: alex379
